review.reviewBody: I bought this for my granddaughter, and she loves it
review.name: Great !!

review.reviewBody: I bought a Kankan backpack for my daughter ten years that has lasted all this time. I bought myself one about two years ago and they are not the same quality. The zipper broke on my backpack within just a year! I took it in to get fixed, but it broke again after just a few months. I took it in a second time to be fixed and it broke AGAIN. What a huge disappointment. The quality has gone way down. I would not buy another bag from this company. Ive recommended this company to many people and now I regret it.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the "Design your own" Kanken. I am thoroughly satisfied! The colors are rich and I'm pleased with the accuracy of the pigments compared to the image online. The material is thick and not cheaply made at all.

This backpack packs a good amount for my day hikes and weekend urban exploration and museum hopping.
Love my Kanken :D
review.name: Durabley made and aesthetically pleasing

review.reviewBody:
I bought mine in the ochre colour 8 years ago and have used it consistently for about 4 of them. After washing it with lukewarm water, a sponge and fabriic detergent the colour has faded significantly and is almost white or beige on some spots. Having followed the instructions, I am incredibly disappointed that colour has faded so much with a simple wash by hand, especially when I have followed instructions. Considering the price and reputation of quality I expected much better. 

I am looking into dying it now because it looks way too distressed. The seams have also come apart in some places, but I guess I can easily fix that myself. 

I don't think I would every buy another one considering the price and colour fading. Other than that no complaints, but I think the quality is overhyped.
review.name: Did not meet expectations, color faded

review.reviewBody: I wish I could love this bag as much as a lot of folks do but I do not. I was so happy upon receiving my dark navy blue backpack with rainbow stripe straps, but after wearing a white shirt the blue coloring rubbed all over my back and ruined my white shirt
review.name: Ruined my favorite shirt

review.reviewBody: I own 3 of them. 2 mini & two classics in different colors and I love it so much!! I use for work and my lunchbox slips right into it perfectly. There's enough pockets for me and I use the large padded pocket to hold my kindle.
review.name: My favorite backpack ever!

review.reviewBody: I have had this bag since 2017 and I beat the crap out of it and it  has held up beyond my expectations. . The only thing I wish is that I could wash it better, because I am so hard on my stuff. I would put one more strip of padding on the bottom of the area for the laptop and two way zippers for the front little pocket, One other suggestion is for the side pockets where you can put your drinks it would be cool if one of those was a little longer, and you could zip it up.. ..This bag is very well made, nothing has come apart, nothing has had to be replaced and all the zippers are intact at almost 8 years since purchase with daily use!
review.name: Excellent Daily Backpack

review.reviewBody: I was bought this for my 11th birthday and now 7 years on it still remains my favourite backpack. It has never broken and has minimal obvious signs of wear. This is a really good quality backpack
review.name: Great Durability

review.reviewBody: I bought the one in Singapore, and the quality and strength of this backpack is AMAZING. I think the seat pad it comes with is very useful and helpful too. Overall, amazing design. It's fashionable, strong, and you can match it with almost anything. Please continue to make bore bags like this. Love y'all!
review.name: LOVE the strength of this backpack.

review.reviewBody: About to buy my second one of these, I bought mine back in 2016 and it has come with me on every single trip abroad, been used as a daily bag through university, and now comes to work with me regularly. It's like a tardis fitting absolutely loads in, and the fact it opens all the way around means I can easily access everything inside! It's also much more aesthetically pleasing having thin straps, and by some magic seems to be better for my back than any other bag I've used! It's a bit worn and torn now but has lasted me YEARS and I really have used it for everything! I wish they were a bit more affordable but can't really complain when the quality is so good
review.name: This really is the best backpack

name: Kanken 16L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I upgraded to the Dura Ace DI-2 rear derailleur from a failed Ultegra DI2 rear derailleur just outside the warranty period. The Dura ace version is lighter  and integration with my DI2 system was flawless. It shifts pefectly. I have Sram Red AXS eTap on my other bike and its a great system also, but nothing shifts as quickly and precisely as the Dura Ace components.
review.name: Perfect upgrade from my failed Ultegra

review.name: Great but a little small

review.reviewBody: Got this for overnight camping. Perfect for two people. Any more might be too small.
review.name: Perfect for two

review.reviewBody: I like the size 1.5 L for 1-2 people but overall fit and finish leaves me a little disappointed compared to GSI kettles I own. Kind of rough around the edges, handle not so smooth and just overall feels much cheaper - don?t know if I will keep.
review.name: 1.5 good size, not as nice as GSI

review.reviewBody:
We have the 1.5L version and using it in an unconventional way. We bought it for our solar oven. In general, it works great with only a couple of downsides. The design is very nice and it pours very nice as well. After a few weeks of use, we noticed that it would leak from the handle attachments, around the rivets. The workaround is to pour slower and that is fine. Also, because the solar oven heats from above, the handle gets super hot and requires protection when removing the kettle from the oven. 

In summary, love the design, but our unconventional use may be causing some strain on the handle attachments causing some leaking.
review.name: Small leaking issue

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: Review without using the snowsuit yet. . . it seems like very nice quality. Seems warm but lightweight/movable. Is definitely on the larger size and will take some growing into but that is part of the selling point of two seasons. The pattern is nice. I'm a fan of the reflective additions.
review.name: Review without using the snowsuit

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: This is our second Reima snowsuit and I absolutely love this company and their products! The Reimatec is great for our 3 year old who loves playing in the snow with his dog. He easily stays outside for an hour and is kept dry thanks to the quality material, loops over the boots, and overlapped zipper. I appreciate the longer zipper in this suit as it makes it easier to wiggle on. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Amazing snowsuit keeps my kid playing outside!

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: Amazing quality. The suit isnt too bulky (easier for children to move around while exploring) and most of all its very warm. We have very cold winters and spend many hours outside enjoying nature in the cold and my children are always warm and can easily move around in their suit.
review.name: Waterproof Reima snow suit

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: The quality of the Lightweight Sandals - Bungee is terrible. The threads are sticking out, the seams are rough and rubbed feet, the sole wore out during the first week, the color of the sandals does not correspond to what is actually shown on the website. Im so disappointed with sandals. Dont cost their money
review.name: Terrible quality of sandals

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: Very happy about the snowsuits I bought. The sizes were perfect!
review.name: Nice quality and cute outfits

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: Perfect for layering! And I know my little guy will stay warm and dry while not being constricted!
review.name: Excellent

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: Perfectly fits my 3 year old and there is enough room for the next season. Kept him toasty warm and dry during the north east winter.

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: Ordered the Puhuri snowsuit but it came with a bit of damage on the detachable hood. Sent it back for exchange and got the new item in perfect condition. Exchange process was easy. The little one could not wait for winter so she can finally use it
review.name: Little one picked the color and loved it

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: A must for cold weather or cool wet weather here in the PNW. This is our 2nd suit, and has been amazing for keeping our active 1yo cozy as she romps around in puddles and mud and sits on wet grass etc. It's lightweight enough so she can move pretty well, and the bright colors keep her visible on a gray day.
review.name: Keeps baby warm and dry!

review.itemreviewed: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'
review.reviewBody: The snowsuit looks and feels like the same quality as the one I bought last year. This will be a size up for the coming winter as she is still wearing size 92. I am sure we will get years of use out of this.
review.name: The snowsuit looks and feels

name: Puhuri Reimatec Winter Overall - Infant Boys'

review.reviewBody: I was very happy with this jacket. I got the medium and its a little tight in the chest, but my chest measurement is 43 inches. With a thermal under-layer, this coat keeps me warm down to about 32. If it gets colder or if theres much wind, I would wear a rain jacket on top of it.
review.name: Very nice coat.

review.reviewBody: Great jacket with very durable water repellent fabric.   Could be a bit warmer.
review.name: Great jacket.

review.reviewBody: Keeps me warm down to about 40-45 with a shirt underneath. Blocks wind great, so lightweight it's easy to throw in a multi day pack without thinking much.
review.name: Proper fit, light weight and warm.

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket. Super warm, comfortable, and looks really good. Im 6 165lbs and the medium fits me perfect.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Im 66, so my jackets always show my belly when I use/lift my arms. The cut of this jacket is perfect and solves the issue. The armpit seam is very high up the jacket. You can move your arms and the jacket stays in place. Almost feels tailored.
review.name: A Coat for Every Eventuality

review.reviewBody:
Nice jacket, I have only worn it a couple times but so far I like it and it will be added to the rotation.  

The Material feels more cloth like than your traditional down puffy jacket and it was plenty warm the other morning when i used while blowing snow off the driveway.  I have a little bit of a love hate relationship with the zipper however.  I really like how easy it is to zipp all the way up especially when getting up to the last few inches in the face area, I also like the two way and that i can open it up at the bottom.  I do however struggle a bit every time Im trying to start the zipper.

I like that all the pockets are insulated to the outside even the chest pocket, doesnt seem like much but if you put a phone in the breast pocket it wont be as subjected to the elements and will maintain battery life longer.  

Packability is ok perhaps if i was going backpacking i would pick something that would pack down a bit more but for regular car camping or around town and walking the dogs great jacket.

when i first put the jacket on i notice that i would like to have a little bit more room in the armpit area, but once i head out for activities i forget all about that and it hasnt bothered me.

Im 59 185lbs 32 inseam with 42 chest.  I got a large and i feel it fits true to size.
review.name: Clean and Simple Puffy

review.reviewBody:
Ive had this jacket for about a year - bought it because my wife got one and I was jealous I love everything about it. Fit is slim, not too baggy so keeps heat in (Im 511, 180, size M). Pockets have the puffy material on the outside of your hands so it brings body warmth to those pockets which is awesome. Stretch is great. I have no problems with it after a year of use hiking, skiing, camping, etc.  Ive contemplated buying another in case they stop making it 

I saw some comments about the filler balling up after washing. I had the same freak out moment when I first washed it but all you do it tumble try with a couple of tennis balls and it fluffs right back up.  Love this jacket!

Highly recommend!
review.name: One of my favorite jackets I own

review.reviewBody: Just bought today. I live in MN. I have warm coats and know whats good to keep you warm, and not burn you up if ur hiking, snowshoeing, Ect. For a very light and comfortable coat. That actually keeps you warm. Its a great coat so far. Idk how I feel about it in the woods but I have other coats for that. This does the job. And is worth the money. The cuffs could be adjustable but not a big deal
review.name: Love the look

review.reviewBody:
I work as a rock climbing guide on the Front Range and I need warm layers when I'm being active at high elevations. 

This thing is definitely warm. The 700-fill down does its job to insulate well and still be super, super light. I also really like that I can use this as a semi-active layer because it really does move and fit with my body. I'm used to down jackets being a stopped-and-snacking layer, so this is a welcome change.

I think this piece is perfect for someone who plans to spend time up high (10,000+) and wants to move/skin/be active in this layer. It also looks great, so it can function as an around-town jacket, too!

I'm 5'10" and 170 - the medium fit me perfectly.
review.name: Stretchy, warm, featured!

review.reviewBody:
I am a rock climbing Guide in Moab who spends their time between the desert and the Colorado Rockies. A down jacket is a must have, especially during these freeze or fry temps.

I have had a strechdown jacket before and loved it but it was a bit too big so I decided to get a Large this time around. I am 6'2" 225lbs with a positive ape index and the large fits exactly how I want it to fit: closer to the body without excess torso room. However, the sleeves fit great but could not be any shorter.

I am a big fan of the insulation being Blue Sign approved and that the chest zippered pocket has an extra large opening that way you can stick whatever you want in there. The cuffs also have a nice touch to them: essentially they are folded over in a way that there is no rough fabric at the cuff.

This jacket is great for anyone who needs a down jacket, really. You won't be disappointed!
review.name: Great Down Jacket!

name: StretchDown Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Orvis does it again with these boots. Perfect for all day on the river, comfortable and lightweight. I could even do a some hiking in these to get to those more remote fishing holes.
review.name: Great fishing boots!

review.reviewBody: Bought these boots for my girlfriend. Although I didn?t purchase them specifically for fishing, they surpassed her expectations. We hunt for Lake Superior agates and do a lot of wading along the rocky shoreline. Sturdy, lightweight, and good drainage. She uses the Orvis Gravel Guard Booty and Sealskinz Waterproof sock. Perfect system to keep water and small pebbles out and off the feet. As far as Customer Service for returned products, Backcountry cannot find a pair of boots that I returned because they were too big, I haven?t received my refund yet. It?s been nearly three weeks. Buyer beware!
review.name: Great Boot!

name: Ultralight Wading Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Has some great features. Its very adjustable and I like the diagonal zipper. Unfortunately, I struggled to keep the shoulder straps tucked. There is a lot of extra fabric on the sides. I kept trying to either tuck it und the side straps or just let it stick out. Ive had it out on 1 trip, so still figuring it all out.
review.name: Plenty of room to adjust to plus size

review.reviewBody: Im a dragonboater. My Layla PFDs armholes are cut such that they do not interfere with my stroke at all. The off-set zipper and womens cut lets it fit perfectly around my torso. I also like that Astral is responsibly environmental in their material selection.
review.name: Very comfy

review.reviewBody: Chest size is 34C, 27 waistline. I was worried that XS was going to be too small and I wouldnt be able to close and zip it up but its perfect. I have a little extra natural padding around my stomach too so maybe more of a size 5 (?), but I still needed to adjust the top straps and the shoulder straps tighter. I think if youre a size six, you should size up. Otherwise, you should be fine. I read somewhere that a size 4/27 in a Small has to cinch it way down in oder to get a proper fit.
review.name: Great for small person for SUP

review.reviewBody: This life jacket is exactly what Ive been looking for. As someone with a larger chest, I love all the adjustable straps and flexible materials, it helps you get the perfect fit. Im not the strongest swimmer so this gives me so much more confidence out on the water. Highly recommend this one!
review.name: Finally found one that fits!

name: Layla Personal Flotation Device - Women's

This is a great legging. The 200 weight merino feels warm and durable without needing to be 250 weight. I do not like the 150 weight as it feels like it could rip or fall apart at any time.

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased an aeroshell and Blade + MIPS helmet. This is my third Lazer helmet so I'm quite happy with how they make helmets. The aeroshell is my second and very unlike the first one I purchased, this version is made of a very thin plastic much like a child's Halloween mask. It had a small crack in front center when I unwrapped it. As soon as I fitted it onto the helmet 3 more cracks formed on both sides laterally from the front. I know the aeroshell will no doubt crack further upon removal and be rendered useless thereafter. Come on Competitive Cyclist. Why are you selling such a poorly made product.? Too bad I had to rate it to submit the review.
review.name: Very low quality aeroshell

name: Blade+ Aeroshell

review.reviewBody: Im 50 and wear a size medium in tops for broad shoulders, bust and chest. The way the backpack sits high, even on the model, doesnt work because I dont want my head hitting the pack. For both packs, the chest strap is adjustable for height but when the straps are at the highest the shoulder straps dont sit right. Also the hardware for the chest strap isnt an easy release - it feels cheap and you have to work to get it open. I was also disappointed that the large pack is different from the version that is just 1 pack and doesnt have a laptop sleeve. Feels heavy. I do like the top of the large pack and how the zippers lock.
review.name: Not for petite or busty ladies

review.reviewBody: Very nice product I recommend 100% good good good good good
review.name: Thule Landmark

review.name: Patagonia Jacket

review.reviewBody: When I saw this on sale and at a good price, I just had to buy it. It's not every day that I can find sale items in my size on sale. This is a great warm jacket for cool spring/fall evenings and mornings. As all other reviews this does fit with more room worn with the nylon on the inside, but it fits me great with the fleece on the inside. I am 5'9" 170 with a 42" chest and the Large is great. My only complaint is that although I got it a good price it is now on sale at a awesome price.
review.name: great lightweight Jacket

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket its very warm with limited bulk, and because its reversible, its like getting 2 jackets for the price of one. I can wear the tide pool blue into the office on chilly mornings, then flip it to the red fleece side when I change into jeans for happy hour. Super useful.
review.name: So useful

review.reviewBody: Good solid jacket the length bit shorter except this everything perfect for me
review.name: Stylish spring / autumn jacket

hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Clifton Edge Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! I walk a lot and these shoes are the best ones I've ever had.
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: Bought to use at work I'm on my feet all day. They are good fit and feel good , but not as good as bondi 7
review.name: Nice shoe

review.reviewBody: One of my top favorite shoes to workout in! I've put it through multiple boot camps and running 5ks. Overall amazing shoe!
review.name: Awesome shoe!

review.reviewBody: I decided to try Hoka after experiencing some knee pain while jogging. Wow, these did not disappoint. I no longer have knee pain while I'm running and these took a minute, yes, one whole minute off my mile time. They are very lightweight and comfortable. Highly recommend!
review.name: Awesome awesome awesome

review.reviewBody: I have 3 pairs of hokas. after a severe ankle injury to multiple tendons and ligaments, i found it extremely difficult to get my normal gait back and walk without pain-until I found these. I transitioned from the bondi (which was more like a walking boot and what I needed) but as I transitioned into more of a run again I loved the cushion and look of the Clifton edge. I want a pair in every color!
review.name: Obsessed

review.reviewBody: I was expecting to love the shoes as a friend told me she loves hers. However, they seemed like nothing special, and I did not like them as well as the Brooks or Clarks I already have. They were fine as far as comfort goes, and lightweight. But I did not find wearing them to be enjoyable or noticeably different.
review.name: I returned the HOKA shoes

review.reviewBody: I walk about 4 - 6 miles a day and my ankles, toes, and arches don't hurt anymore.
review.name: I really like the sneakers.

review.reviewBody: The construction of the tongue makes it extremely difficult to get my foot into the shoe. I won't buy this model of Clifton again. I hope the construction won't be applied to the other models.
review.name: Clifton comfortable once you get it on

review.reviewBody: Its very light and sturdy. Great fit. Not painful at all to the toes and not tight. Very very comfortable.
review.name: Just LOVE this product

review.reviewBody: I bought the shoe for work. I've never had a shoe with the extended rubber sole. It took a little getting used too. I'm not sure how I feel about that as far as style but otherwise it's worth every penny!
review.name: It's a very comfortable shoe.

name: Clifton Edge Running Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: Expedition Fuel Bottle Cap
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Expedition Fuel Bottle Cap online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Excellent product. Completely leakproof, strong and sturdy. Msr fuel bottles are a great value and have never let me down. I love the simplicity of the expedition caps . My only gripe is that i have to buy the bottle with the annoying child proof caps and purchase the good ones at additional cost. Still tho, i consider the peace of mind of having leakproof spare fuel well worth it.
review.name: Long time returning customer.

review.reviewBody: It is a fuel cap, not much to say. This is the older model and easier to use than the newer models that have a safety cap. I like the pour value and the ability to put a tent stake in the cap and twist it to open it! Great Item.
review.name: Classic and Solid!

review.reviewBody: This cap is lighter weight and works as designed. With MSR you get what you pay for, thoughtful design and quality.
review.name: Another excellent product!

review.reviewBody: Excellent and lasting design for my old MSR fuel bottle.
review.name: Old Man Happy!

review.reviewBody:
Now  I'm a happy camper!

Very pleased that MSR offers this replacement part. Helps me keep a fantastic Whisperlite International stove going for over 25 years.
review.name: Now  I'm a happy

review.reviewBody: Fast, professional service and excellent quality product.
review.name: Fast, professional service and excellent

review.reviewBody: Great, I wish they came standard, or respectively, no cap at all with a buy your own adventure available. Way better then standard option in every single way. Smaller, lighter, substantially less prone to failure(not that I have ever broken one in many years of use of the child safe kind) but this one almost cant break.
review.name: Awesome, wish it came standard.

review.reviewBody: The main reason i switched over to msr is because primus doesn't offer these.... Childproof caps do work really well though....they leak so much, you'll never use them, and the children end up being safe...
review.name: Works- This is why i ditched my primus omni

review.reviewBody: Love this cap! Its far better than the annoying childproof cap that comes with new bottles.
review.name: Love this cap! Its far

review.reviewBody: This should be the default cap! Works perfectly, and is easy to manipulate even with gloves and cold hands. Childproof caps on the trail dont make sense for most. Make them optional.
review.name: Make it the standard!

name: Expedition Fuel Bottle Cap

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet for my son in laws 50th birthday. He had picked it out at our local ski shop. Backcountry had the BEST price. He is very pleased that he got exactly what he wanted.
review.name: Exactly the helmet he wanted!

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Matte Poppy/Black colored helmet and when I received it, the color was more of a rose or peach color.  The color is definitely not a poppy red like it's shown in the photo.  I have a red ski jacket that I was hoping to match and the helmet wasn't even close to being red.  So I returned it and ate the shipping back to Backcountry.  The fit is also definitely more round than the oval it used to be years ago.
review.name: Poppy color isn't red.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a new helmet and the Vantage had everything.  #1-Ventilation, the Vantage has two separate vent levers and they both have two settings, open, half and closed. So you have lots of different settings for your needs and they are easy to operate.  #2-MIPS and Koyroid, safe and light nuff said.  #3-Removable ear pads for spring time.  Kind of tricky due to BOA wire, but you can get it done.  #4 BOA fit dial for perfect size.  #5- Mini visor for just enough coverage and perfect fit with Smith goggles.  The terra matte color is a little strange, but so am I.  Couldn't pass on the great price.  Very happy with helmet.
review.name: Everything in one helmet

review.reviewBody: Great helmet with lots of safety features. Looks great, fits well, is comfortable and the vents are easy to use and they do a fabulous job regulating temperature.
review.name: Great helmet with safety features and comfort

review.reviewBody: Love it! Great fit and seemless fit with smith 4d mag goggles! Buy it!
review.name: Love it! Great fit and

review.reviewBody: Based on Smith's size chart, I should have been on the upper side of a Large helmet. After having read the reviews, I ordered a XL helmet instead. Despite this, the helmet is too small. I'm sure it's a great helmet and I was excited to use it, but Smith has to get the sizing right.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: Will recommend this helmet to everyone who asks about it.
review.name: Will recommend this helmet to

review.reviewBody: I took a pretty big slam to the back of my head on my first ride with this helmet and Im not brain dead so Im gonna say it works as advertised. Im actually pretty surprised the helmet is still intact as well. I didnt feel hot or cold with it, so thats cool. Style is subjective.
review.name: Protection works

review.reviewBody: Really disappointed in the overall fit. Ive tried a couple options and need the helmet for an upcoming trip so I will make do.. but the sizing is way way off. XL is entirely too small on the crown but too loose lower down. Disappointed
review.name: Really disappointed in the overall

review.reviewBody:
The Vantage is the best helmet ever. Comfortable, safe, sturdy and reliable. My back story - I crashed in December, basically sliding out and landing with direct impact on the top of my head above my left eye. I was knocked out. Taken to the hospital, CT scan, EKG, the whole assessment. The top of my older Vantage broke off and the interior cellular matrix was crushed and the helmet rim broken. Very serious to say the least. 
The helmet was totaled but I fortunately was unhurt. I credit the Vantage for doing its job in saving me from serious injury. 
I immediately ordered another Vantage because of my experience. There was no other choice from my perspective.
As a full time ski coach, I highly recommend the Vantage to my clients and, frankly, to anyone wholl listen!
review.name: The Vantage is the best

name: Vantage Mips Helmet
Smith Vantage MIPS Helmet | GH Review

review.reviewBody: I live in Northern Minnesota. These mittens are great for my outdoor adventures with my pups!! Very easy to pull on and off.
review.name: Toasty mittens!

review.reviewBody: I love my Patagonia mittens. Theyre nice and warm. I like the little thumb pull on. Theyre just slightly tight around the wrist.  Which can make it slightly hard to get your hand in without the minor detail.
review.name: Mitten love

review.reviewBody: Was surprised how warm they are for the light weight. The quality you expect for the brand. Have used down to mid-20s temps and they did fine. Size as expected. Snug at wrist to keep cold and snow out.
review.name: Great value

review.reviewBody: First of all this is a great mitt, with good construction, good insulation, typical patagonia quality and style, but I returned it for a couple reasons. Firstly it's sized a bit big, it's size larger than most Men's medium mits. I thought maybe I could layer this mitt with a liner underneath, however generally when I use a liner, I expect the outer mitt to be more heavy duty however the palm fabric doesn't cover the finger tips.
review.name: Sizing is a bit off

name: Nano Puff Mitts

review.reviewBody: I waited a bit to make the investment on this dress. I am very happy with the my purchase. I got so many compliments! Very comfortable and easy to dress up or down. Fun with a Jean jacket in cooler weather. I will most likely get another one of these in another color
review.name: Perfect black dress

review.reviewBody: I ordered the XS after reading lots of helpful reviews (I tend to be on the cusp between XS and S, and I'm pretty short at 5.2). As it turns out, the dress just isn't a good fit for a petite build. The arm holes and back neckline were both too big. Wanted to love it - it's a great design - but it wasn't a good fit for me.
review.name: Not a good fit for me

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So cute and comfortable. Bought this first in the copper penny stripe and liked it so much that I got a second one in black. Very flattering and I get a lot of compliments wearing them. Im 53 140 lbs and 32DD and S fit perfectly. A little longer than it looks on the model of course.
review.name: My New Favorite Dress!

review.reviewBody: Love! Comfy and will be a nice addition to wardrobe
review.name: Black Rib Dress

review.reviewBody: Love this dress! Comfortable and flattering, doesnt cling and drapes nicely. Highly recommend! Bought a medium - i wear a sized medium in some other carve bottoms, but a 12 in the Oahu short.
review.name: Great Dress

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this dress because I love Carve and need a simple black dress, but it was very snug on me. I bought a medium (my usual size), but had to return because of the fit and style-just not for me. It could work on someone who has a flatter stomach. At this stage of my life I need something looser :)
review.name: Wanted to love

review.reviewBody:
I was lucky to have the opportunity to test out the Zero Breeze portable AC unit on a few overland adventures this summer. Traveling with 2 dogs poses lots of challenges, especially in the heat of Summer. The Zero Breeze allowed us to leave the pups in the truck while grabbing lunch and running errand etc. By keeping my trucks rear window open I can run the cool air hose to the interior keeping them cool and the unit out of their way. They were big fans!
With most of our camping in 2024 being at high elevations with fairly cool temps at night, we haven't needed to run it through the tent at night. Moab in the summer is a different story though. I'm excited to make a trip down there now that we have the ability stay cool at night. While the unit isn't crazy large or heavy it does take up some precious space on a camping trip. The tradeoff though is well worth it because of the freedom, especially as dog owners.
review.name: Overlanding luxury

name: Mark 2

hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Terravia 28L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this for an 11-day hike of the Walkers Haute Route in the Alps (staying in hotels and Cabanes, not camping). It worked out great, carried 15-20 comfortably and the size was perfect - not too large but allowed me to take some extra stuff from my wife when we realized her pack was too heavy and was slowing her down. The integrated rain cover was very handy as we had steady rain at least 3-4 days and it kept the contents of the pack dry as well as can be expected. External pockets were very useful and I kept my passport and inreach in the internal zippered pocket for security. Overall a great pack, simple, light, and very functional. I don't like the complicated, heavy, and bulky frame suspensions found on many osprey and gregory packs so I was happy to find this one from Patagonia that keeps it simple.  I'm 6'1 with a 33" waist and the large fits great. I appreciate that the waist strap is not ridiculously long also.
review.name: Great simple, light, and functional pack

name: Terravia 28L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes mainly for the Boa fastener and Velcro strap.  My previous shoes did not fit great and were a hassle to get on every time I went for a ride (I hate timing my shoes so always slip them on and leave laces tied).  With these shoes I simply undo the Velcro, pop the Boa, and Im out.  Then slipping them on is easy and it takes a few seconds to reattach the Velcro and synch the Boa.  They are very comfortable (I use the same size as I purchase my hiking and running shoes) and easy to keep clean with the smooth exterior surface.
review.name: Easy to put on and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately this shoe misses the mark in a key area. Let?s start with the good . This shoe fits me nicely. It has a roomy toe box, a heel grip to minimize slippage and most importantly a BOA latch combined with a single Velcro strap. The bad news is that one of the most important attributes that most riders are looking for is weak and that is GRIP. Holy smoke Crank Bros, you know the competition and you know what is needed. How could you screw up the grip . I love wearing the shoes but there is no comparison to Five Tens. I kept hoping after some use the soles would become more pliable and tacky. That has not happened. Not very confidence inspiring. Get a grip Crank Bros.
review.name: Crank Bros. Stamp BOA misses the mark

review.reviewBody: I love the style, fit, weight, BOA, but these do not inspire confidence on the bike. I'm also riding with Crankbrothers Stamp pedals. The grip just isn't quite there and I found my foot slipping off my pedals way more often then my years old Five Tens. I really gave these a good try (dozen or so rides) and really wanted to like these but I'm back to my old shoes. Putting on my 2 year old Five Tens, I immediately felt way more grip and confident on the bike. Won't be riding with these again.
review.name: Poor Grip

name: Stamp BOA Cycling Shoe

hasVariant.name: Batwing Awning

hasVariant.name: Batwing Awning
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rhino-Rack Batwing Awning online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ordered this a while ago, and found that I was missing the brackets to install the rack onto a RhinoRack roof rack.  But I did not need the brackets because I'm doing a custom installation onto racks on a teardrop camper.
review.name: Mine was missing parts, too.

review.reviewBody:
Ive used this awning on my SUV over the past 3 years and have concluded it is a good value. At first I was disappointed in how easily the plastic connections would break at the spindle if the awning was unsecured and picked up by the wind. However, it is an easy fix and I keep extra parts in the rope bag. I also secure it down with lines and stakes and it does well with moderate wind gusts. The coverage is ample and it is light enough I can install or take it off by myself. 
What sets this awning apart from others is that it can be integrated to an OZ tent as well as wall panels and overhead extensions. I have another 270 degree awning that I can do pull-ups on without down poles but I still tend to use the batwing more often as it is simply more multifunctional.
review.name: Best value

review.reviewBody: Opened up the awning to put it in the rack two days before my trip to see that the brackets were missing and some other small parts. Disappointing to say the least.
review.name: Missing parts
comment: Just had the same thing happen! Any resolution from backcountry? On rhino rack it appears there are a few assembly hardware kits for different racks.

Mine seems to be missing brackets, too.  Ordered it about a month ago, and it was delivered in terrible shape, but no apparent damage to the awning.  But now I'm stuck trying to figure out what I was supposed to get and what else will be missing as I assemble it.

name: Batwing Awning

hasVariant.description: Buy the Continental Race Light Tube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very light and durable tube. I replaced a latex tube with one of these and honestly can not tell a difference except they dont lose 20psi in one day.!
review.name: Very nice tube

review.reviewBody:
I bought six of these. At least three were defective. Two had a slit along the seam and wouldn't hold air. The other had a small hole in it. Cause quite a hassle on the group ride having, having two tubes fail and having to bum a tube.
I'm disappointed because I've used these tubes before and they worked fine and they are light. Maybe I got a bad batch. But I'm checking on my tubes from here on out.
review.name: Defective out of the box

review.reviewBody:
Ive always had good luck with theses tubes. Theyre significantly lighter than the standard Conti Race tubes, and Ive found them to be durable and to hold air well.

Ive never had one with any defects, and theyre about 40 grams lighter than the standard Conti tubes.

Yes, they can flat, like any tube, but I dont get many flats and Ive  been riding these for years.

Theyre also smaller and easier to pack as spares, saving room and weight in my saddle bag.

Ive used these along with Conti 4000 / 5000 series clinchers, the combination provides a very supple and responsive ride.

One review complained about these tearing or pinching when doing a roadside tube change, Ive never had that issue, but then mounting Conti clinchers on my Campy Zoned C17 rims is fairly easy, some rims and tires just dont play well together.

Im also currently riding 700x28 GP 5000 tires, which are nominally outside the size range of these tubes, but I havent noticed any difference in performance for the tubes.
review.name: Great Tubes, Been Using Them For Years

review.reviewBody: These tubes are light and great to ride for sure. Somewhat more puncture-prone 'cause they're thin. But the biggest knock on them is that they are terrible to use for roadside flat replacement because they will tear or pinch if you so much as look at them slightly funny as you're installing them. If you have a tight tire that you have to use a lever to encourage over the rim, well forget it, you're gonna tear or pinch these tubes. I'm using up my stock of these only when I can replace tubes under perfect conditions in my garage. I'm not an idiot, I'm a very experienced mechanic and I've fixed more than a hundred flats on the side of the road and I know all the tricks. These tubes are unforgiving.
review.name: Unforgiving

review.reviewBody: I've used these Race Lights for about a decade.  I have not had a defective one yet.  They feel noticeably lighter than standard tubes, and they also feel a lot more supple.  For just slightly more money than a standard tube, I think they are worth it for the improved ride quality and road feel.  They still flat, obviously, but they don't seem to be any more prone to punctures than standard tubes.
review.name: Reliable lightweight tubes

review.reviewBody: I always test out my tubes before putting them on the wheels. I got 4 to put on my racing carbon wheels, 2 of them were duds out of the box. I am very disappointed. It would be hard to recommend them unless you are willing to test them like. me...Good luck.
review.name: Bought 4...2 were defective...

review.reviewBody: Have been using this tube for 12 years, 5,000 km/yr, pumped at 140psi. Wouldn't think of using any other tube.
review.name: Great tube!

review.reviewBody: That's probably one of the worst tubes I had. Very easy to get flat.
review.name: 4 flats in one week

review.reviewBody: I have tried these on my 25mm GP5000 tires several times over the past year.  I consistently get flats.  I switched to latex 8 months ago and have been riding fine since until I had a puncture.  Unfortunately, I had a spare race light butyl tube as my backup.  This flatted on me before I got home.  I would not recommend these tubes.  I'm wondering if the butyl is stretched too much inside the 25mm tire.  These are both continental products so I would assume they work well together.
review.name: Consistently getting flats with these

review.reviewBody: These are tubes that you fill with air...they work great.
review.name: Tubes work

name: Race Light Tube

review.reviewBody: Splitboarder here. Overall, this is a great pack. All the main stuff needed is there from avy section to helmet stash to radio routing to the important and appreciated Osprey carry comfort & fit. However a couple things need improvement to make this into a highly recommendable pack for fellow splitboarders: (1) My biggest complaint: lower A-frame carry straps do not fit most split skis, so we are relegated to the vertical carry only which I, and many of us, do not prefer. So the lower straps needs more adjustability range to fit split skis. (2) The straps need more sewn gear attachment points. My radio clipped to the one attachment point ends up being nearly on top of the shoulder rather than in front/on my chest where it's more easily accessible. I end up fumbling around to find the radio and button. Perhaps slightly longer straps as well. (3) The hip belts could be a bit bigger, along with a wider/more substantial webbing belt and buckle. Pockets on both sides would be preferable, and can still keep the gear loop on one side along with a zippered pocket. (4) Side zipper access to main compartment. (5) Lastly as a bonus as icing on the cake, an external water bottle pocket and a little more padding on the back panel.
review.name: Great pack that needs some improvements

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pack. Its my mtb trail building pack. I can fit my sawing helmet in the little helmet spot. Which is great. Tons of room! Just enough pockets. I really dig the hip pocket. I find the quality to be super durable. Almost to a fault because the only annoying thing is sometimes the zipper on the main pouch can be a B to zip. I think its because the frame and probably what you would want for a zipper there, toughness. No big really. Glad I went the osprey route!
review.name: I love this pack. Its

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing back pack that is well designed for touring. Great gear management and very comfortable.
review.name: Amazing back pack that is

review.reviewBody: I have been using this pack for my snowboarding trips this season, and so far, I LOVE IT! This particular gold and black pack is such a good-looking pack. I love how the main compartment is on the back side rather than the front. So, when I need to put my belongings in and out of the pack, snow doesn't get on me. It's very comfortable and meets all my needs as far as what I need it for.
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody: I've put 200k vertical on my Soelden in the backcountry. I use Drift boards and carry my solid board on all uphill, so my main priority is how effectively the pack carries a board, and then organization is a close second. I haven't found a pack yet that absolutely perfect in every detail, but this checks most of the boxes. Durability is top notch, I think most people could get one of these and never buy another pack again (but Osprey will take care of you if anything came apart anyway,) I use Osprey for mountain biking and travel as well. Hard to beat.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: This looks exactly like the Black Diamond Dawn Patrol pack, suspiciously so. Minor differences maybe, but it looks like you just slapped an Osprey logo on the Dawn Patrol pack. If I was Black Diamond I would maybe get my legal department involved.
review.name: suspicious

name: Soelden 32L Backpack

review.reviewBody: My wife wore these on our wedding day and looked beautiful. She said they were comfortable after a little break in period and she loves them. Even after our wedding she continues to wear them and love.
review.name: Wedding Day Approved

review.reviewBody: Great boot at a great price. Cute and comfortable. Would recommend no slip patches for bottom.
review.name: Red Dixon boot is super cute.

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable booties ever!! I wear them almost every day.

These are amazingly beautiful booties that I now own in three colors.  My poodle puppy loved them too and I had to buy a second pair of the brown pair as she thought they were for her.  They are so comfortable I can wear them all day walking and they are incredibly versatile. Very well made, should last for years.
review.name: Perfect bootie

review.reviewBody: This boot is super comfortable and very stylish. It is a boot that I can wear all day and not have sore feet!
review.name: A boot built with style and comfort

review.reviewBody: In short, these boots are spectacular. I was on the hunt for a pair of witch boots for a Halloween costume, but I wanted something with a western style - also something that wouldnt be worn once a year just for a costume. After much online shopping, I finally found the Dixon in Brooklyn black. This shoe is now a staple of my everyday wardrobe, but still has all the witchy vibes necessary for my costume. Fit is as expected. Limited break in time. Just a fantastic shoe. Obsessed.

description: Buy the LEKI Traveller Carbon Trekking Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Traveller Carbon Trekking Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the LEKI Traveller Carbon Trekking Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Although I wanted to like these sticks (they are ultra-light), I returned them.  The handles were too small in diameter, forcing you to hold them with an uncomfortable, tight grip (and my hand is not large).  I also dislike the straps.  They felt dangerous as you couldn't slip out of them quickly - they are designed with a funnel-like shape, and you have to pull apart the velcro before you can get them off.  It felt dangerous to me.
review.name: Two drawbacks, had to return
comment: Thank you for your feedback, Louise. We apologize that the Nordic Walking poles did not meet your needs. The poles come equipped with the innovative Trigger Shark grip system that enables users to attach the straps over their hands and click into the grip. This feature is intended to help propel users as they plant and push off. However, if you need to grip the poles too tightly, we suggest you explore our trekking collection featuring the Aergon Air grip. These poles come with a traditional loop strap and a larger, more ergonomic grip, providing greater comfort and stability.

review.reviewBody: I use these walking around the neighborhood and they work great walking on asphalt and concrete. The hand grip is very comfortable to use and they seem like they will be durable. Im very happy with my purchase,
review.name: Comfortable and great for city walking

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love, love, love these poles, from the grip, strap, locks, and tip. The weight and balance feel perfect. These poles feel like a changer for me, and constantly inspiring me to make little corrections to my technique. And the purchase/customer service has been great!! Thank you so much, Leki!!!!!
review.name: Silky Smooth, Inspiring and Balanced

review.reviewBody: High quality poles. Very light and strong and well made.
review.name: Walking Buddies

name: Traveller Carbon Trekking Poles

description: Buy the Columbia Chippewa II Mitten - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chippewa II Mitten - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Columbia Chippewa II Mitten - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Here's a positive review:

"I'm so glad I bought these mittens for my son! They're absolutely perfect for keeping his hands warm and toasty. The material is super soft and cozy, and the fit is just right. I love that they're easy to put on and take off, making them a breeze for my son to manage on his own. The quality is top-notch, and I can tell they'll last throughout the winter season and beyond. The color and design are adorable, and my son loves wearing them. He's received so many compliments already! The mittens have been a game-changer for our outdoor adventures together - no more cold hands!
review.name: Ready for Winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pretty cool little mittens.  Easy to get on and seem like they will keep little hands warm.  Unfortunately they didnt fit our 1-1/2 yo, but I gave them to nephews baby
review.name: Baby mittens

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These gloves are perfect for little hands.  They don't have a thumb, so keep that in mind if your little likes to grasp the snow.  My little is too young to really play in the snow, so these work great.  I don't have to fight to get his thumb in the hole.  There is a zipper to open it wider to get his hands in before zipping it tight.
review.name: Perfect for little hands

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these for a friends upcoming arrival so cute!
review.name: Adorable warm mittens

review.reviewBody: My baby is only 4 months and I couldnt use it. The zipper opens, but there is a little flat of fabric within the zipper that doesnt allow the mitten to open wide. If you have a baby you know the struggle to fit anything to their hands, imagine something extremely tight and small. I honestly dont know who it could fit any baby to be honest. With much sacrifice I got it like 3/4 in. Zip and two minutes later when I opened my baby arms and wrist was all marked down and red from the inside of it. We all hate it!
review.name: Too small & too difficult to put on

review.reviewBody: Although this seem to be constructed well and waterproof, my 15 month old is able to easily shake them off of his hands, so they don't stay on for more than a few minutes.
review.name: Well Constructed But Do Not Stay On 15 Month Old For More Than A Few Minutes

review.reviewBody: These are cute and have a zipper for ease to put on infant's hand.This was bought for a 10 month old baby.  However, they are useless since they slide right off. They are going back to Columbia.
review.name: Infant mittens

review.reviewBody: I just bought these for my 11 month old daughter. They are just "muffs" for your hands- they do not have thumbs. This might be fine for a baby under, say, 6 months, but the design will not work for an older baby. At the time of my purchase, the website didn't say anything about the lack of thumbs, and the photos only showed the top of the mitten so this issue was not apparent from the pictures. I requested that the website be updated to accurately show this aspect of these "mittens." On the upside, when I contacted customer service about this issue, they waived the return shipping fee.
review.name: No thumbs

review.reviewBody: The fit is perfect and they are warm. Plus you will not lose them because of the little clip attachments.
review.name: Warm Fingers

review.reviewBody: I love that it has a strap on the wrist to keep my babys hands warm and from falling out. Next time they should add at least a portion for the thumb.
review.name: Good

name: Chippewa II Mitten - Kids'

review.reviewBody: Love the overalls. The adjustable strap in the back make it fitted and wide leg all at the same time. Would def order again.
review.name: Amazing overalls

review.reviewBody: Since I purchased these I have worn them at least twice a week. They have become my go to for easy, cute and comfortable!
review.name: Extremely comfortable and well made!

review.reviewBody: Really cute, I love the wide wale corduroy and dark green color. However I will definitely have to have them hemmed as they are super long! I think if I sized down the would be too tight in the hips.
review.name: Long inseam

review.reviewBody: Was nervous to order these with the other reviews. I took my measurements and decided to order down a size (s) with going off my hip measurement (Im a small on the hips but medium on the waist). They fit nearly perfectly (torso feels a tad longer than I need it). They are just above the ground for me, my inseam is 30in. They have a cinch in the waist to make them more form fitting if you like. Also love that they have a good amount of stretch to them so they are comfortable to move in. So stoked to wear these and might order another pair!
review.name: The overalls I have been wanting

review.reviewBody: I received my overalls today, and I absolutely love them. I read the reviews and ordered a medium, and they fit perfectly. They are comfortable and well-made! I think I may order another color tonight!
review.name: Awesome Overalls

review.reviewBody:
The medium fits me perfectly. 5'6.25", 148 pounds. I have long legs. I can wear them with the bottom hem down (touch the ground) when it's dry out and hem up when it's raining and both lengths look great. 

The only issue is that the "Scarab" color is not a charcoal-green; they are more like a dark collard green.

I also order the "Harvest Gold" color and I hope they are not much lighter than they appear on screen.

I'd love a black pair!
review.name: I love them but the color is different!

review.reviewBody: Love these overalls but they are too big and long. And now they are on sale. Sad. I should have returned them.
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody: Love these overalls but run large. I am 5'5" and 128 lbs and medium was too big and too long. Should have ordered a small.
review.name: Runs big

review.reviewBody: I love this "cushion". It's lightweight, packable, and environmentally friendly. I use it every outing.
review.name: Lightweight Tush Cush

review.reviewBody:
I bought this on a whim. I had picnic table bench covers already, but was curious about this product and figured it could come in handy. As it turns out, I use this all the time now.  It's great for picnic areas where I am only there for a short while and don't want to set up everything under the sun (like the full bench covers). It stores in the passenger door pocket in my vehicle and is so easy for me to grab up. Whenever I pull this out to use it, I can tell that strangers are giving me the "I wish I had that gear" look. 

Even though I wasn't into the bright colors, they've grown on me. It helps me spot that I've left out it out so that I don't forget it when I'm packing up.  I would absolutely buy this again and recommend to others.
review.name: Exceeds Expectations

review.reviewBody: This sit pad is perfect. It seriously makes SUCH a big difference in comfort level. I take it with me backpacking, climbing, car camping, and to sit on on the bleachers or grass at baseball games.
review.name: Goes with me everywhere

review.reviewBody: Easily portable. Surprisingly helpful for walks with a toddler.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Simple design; easy to use; inexpensive, and lightweight.  I purchased one a year ago and it worked so well, I purchased a second one.
review.name: Great idea for an age-old problem

review.reviewBody: I like the concept of reusing scraps, the light weight, the funky colors and the small form factor, but the pad is so badly made, its laughable.  The different colored foam blebs are barely fused together, instead they look like they've been glued on with lots of gaps, loose chunks and small crevices that won't stand up to real outdoor use.  Not sure what Nemo is doing for quality control, as I saw them in a store and some looked better than others.  If Nemo could actually make the foam pieces fuse together uniformly, it would be a good product, but right now I would pass on it unless I could see it in person.
review.name: Great concept and form, but poorly made

review.reviewBody: Good pad. I leave multiple in the car for wet picnic table seats and serves as great available ground barrier when needed. I would use it in more settings if it were more packable.
review.name: Good reclaimed materials product

review.reviewBody: Wasnt sure how Id like this product initially.  However I am very pleased with it and use it around the house which had mainly hardwood floors.   This product is the go-to item I use when sitting or kneeling on the floor.   I also like that it conveniently folds up.
review.name: Pleasantly surprised

review.reviewBody: I used to take a heavy closed foam pad made for gardening on the car camp trips. Bulky and not so great. The Chipper is different and way better. I'm happy that it's made from recycled stuff, folds small and is super-lightweight (meaning I can use it for backpacking and motorcycle camping!)
review.name: Functional & Funky

review.reviewBody: Great seat pad for my kids events.  Beats an aluminum bleacher seat anyday!
review.name: Nice bleacher pad.
comment: Thanks for the review, glad you're enjoying the Chipper!

review.reviewBody: Tested it out in high winds on a climb of Mount Rainier - Initial impressions: it held up great and even without a hardshell over it, I did not feel the wind.  As our team slowed the pace with increasing slope, I put on a hardshell over it.  With layers of a baselayer, a softshell hoodie, this down, and a hardshell I stayed comfortable even in 70 mph winds and single digit temps.  I appreciate the light weight and packability.  I used the stuff sack filled with other clothes as a pillow at camp.
review.name: Kept me warm

review.reviewBody: I bought one for myself and one for my brother. Perfect weight, warmth and windproof. I did a lot of shopping; most are way too thin, or not windproof. This isnt a puffy coat either - nice and lightweight. Great colors and quality feel. I love this jacket. Backcountry is great too. They don't sell what they don't have, and fast shipping.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: I'm not sure why I purchased a second one of these after my first one from 2018 had the zipper break twice but I did. This new one is worse. The down is very unevenly distributed and the new model is not fitted. It's like wearing a bag. On the one plus side I would say that the hood is really nice.
review.name: breezy and broken

review.reviewBody: its very good and comfortable
review.name: i love it

review.reviewBody: Its a good jacket I like the fit and it keeps me warm for the most part but too expensive for the quality. The problem I had is the feathers leaking out the seams. I wore a black t shirt under it one day and my shirt was covered in feathers.
review.name: good but not great

review.reviewBody: Highly recommend.  188cm  and have freakishly long arms xl fits perfect love the 3rd pocket for stuffing jacket when not in use.   The main zipper is 2 way but needs to be beefier will pop at most  inopportune times.    Towning a definite yes for price, cragging get a more bomb proof zipper.    Otherwise warm and dry puffy that looks and wears great.
review.name: Excellent jacket - zipper needs revision

review.reviewBody:
I really like this coat, since it is super lightweight and warm.
However.the zipper is not constructed well and does not align on the track.
I've only had this jacket a few weeks and have run into this problem.
If someone from the company cab reach out to help with this matter thatd be great.
review.name: Zipper problems

review.reviewBody:
It is hard to find the perfect down jacket. I know because I bought 3 or 4 different ones before settling on this one. I am a big Outdoor Research guy and my go-to option in this price range was the Helium. I really liked the features and tougher material on that jacket but the fit was just so odd for me. The medium fit perfect from the torso up but the waist was squeezing me when zipped and was very short. The large was gigantic on me. Tried some Mountain Hardwear - medium fit too loose and boxy and the large was a trash sack on me. 
Then I got to this Rab! The cut and fit of these is so well thought out. I actually could not decide between the medium or large because they both fit decently and would both work in different situations (layers under or over). I settled on the medium and it is just perfect. It is every-so slightly tight in the armpit/shoulder area which is further motivation to lose the excess 15 pounds I've been carrying on me for the last couple of years. The length is what makes this stand out for me. It fits snug in the torso but also has a slight tail that is sure to keep your waist and belly covered when reaching or bending over. I also love the stitching layout for the neck area when it is zipped all the way. 
As far as performance goes, I have taken it out for a couple of hikes and a couple of bike rides in drizzly/misting conditions at around 40 degrees. It is no surprise that it is plenty warm for 40 degree weather, but it also stands up well to the wet and even moving quickly on a bike on an open road the wind doesn't make it through to the skin at all. About 80% of the jacket has shed the moisture and only a few spots where water hung on soaked through, but I certainly never felt like the insulation was losing any of its performance. 
The stuff sack is a little weird when everything else on the market can stuff into a pocket, but I actually really like it because the shape it stuffs into is nicer than the usual pocket-shaped thing. I just keep it in the chest pocket so its out of the way of my hands and it isn't even noticeable because the stuff sack material is so light and soft. 
My final note is the feel of the jacket. Compared to the other brands I have tried, I would say this has an extra level of "plushness" to it. The outer and inner material is just really soft and less stiff or rigid than some down jackets.
review.name: Excellent fit and feel

review.reviewBody:
This coat looks and fits great (63 180 lbs Large).   The hood and pockets are adequate.  It should be 5 stars BUT like other lightweight jackets I own (for example a Montane), the zipper is cheesy and refuses to engage and zip.  The only way I could manage it is to hold the fabric opposite the zipper pull and pull.    Doing that will cause the fabric to rip, 
over time and is unnecessary if Rab had used a better quality zipper.
review.name: Nice jacket b

review.reviewBody: This is my first Rab product and I'm thrilled beyond expectations.  Initially, I was a little skeptical of the price; however, as it turns out it is a great value.  I wanted a jacket that was in between my heavier winter Arc'teryx and a much lighter one and this Rab jacket hits the spot.  Here's what I love: slim tighter fit, deep pockets, soft material for your chin when you zip jacket up all the way, lightweight, thinness, windproof features, long tail area, elastic around the wrist hand/area.  Rab also did a fantastic job with the hood.  I live in Grand Rapids, MI and this is the perfect jacket for trails, parks, and slipping on while you drive around and run errands.  It's been a long winter and Rab has taken the chill out of my days.  I typically wear this when the temperature is between 30-50 F and only wear a base layer under it.  I honestly haven't found any dislikes.  Goo for it!  You will be happy that you did!
review.name: Above and Beyond Expectations

name: Microlight Alpine Down Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Vittoria Air-Liner Road Tire Insert online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Air-Liner Road Tire Insert
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Air-Liner Road Tire Insert online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Liners improve tubeless tire safety, performance and comfort. They're worth the money and the additional trouble, and they are NOT that hard to install IF you have the right tools. You absolutely have to have the Vittoria Air-Liner Tool, https://www.competitivecyclist.com/vittoria-air-liner-tool. This tool is also essential for removing the tires, and it's fantastically useful for working on any sort of tubeless setup, even without liners. Hands down best bike tire tool ever invented. You also have to have some very soapy water and some patience. Do not even try to use plastic tire levers; they'll break; and do not use steel core levers; they'll scratch your rims. Only use the double levers at the end of the Vittoria tool handle. The included instructions are poorly translated from Italian. Here's what you need to know. 

Install the included multi-port valve stems. Regular valves will not work. Install one bead of the tire into the well of the rim. Lube the entire inside of the tire, the rim bed and the liner with soapy water. (I use a small sponge.) Insert the liner into the tire like a tube, starting opposite the valve and pressing it in with your thumbs. Now begin installing the other bead. It will go like any other tire installation until about 12 inches of bead is left. That's where this is different because there's much more tension on the bead than with a regular installation. Use the pliers of the Vittoria tool to grasp both sides off the tire and pull them into the middle of the rim bed, starting opposite the valve and alternating left and right toward the valve. This step is important because it creates maximum slack in the beads. You're moving them into the center of the rim bed and toward the valve. Use the pliers to pinch the beads together at the last point where both beads are in the rim bed and slide and jam one of the plastic clips between the tire and rim, perpendicular to the rim. The clip will keep the tire from coming off the rim as you increase tension on the bead. Place another clip on the other side of the unmounted section of the bead. Now close the pliers and use both levers on the handle at the same time to carefully leverage one end of the bead onto the rim. The pliers are much longer than a regular tire lever and provide much more leverage. Since they are connected at the hinge, they work in unison. Due to their shape and material, they will not damage your rim or cut your rim tape. Now move the plastic clip to the new point where the bead goes into the rim bed to hold it in place and repeat the leveraging step on the other end of the bead, followed by moving the clip on that side. Keep working both ends of the bead like this until you pop the last section of bead into the rim bed. The whole process should only take 15-20 minutes per wheel.

Once the tire is mounted, follow normal procedure - remove valve core, inflate tire with a compressor until the beads fully seat and pop, deflate, inject Vittoria sealant or any other ammonia-free sealant through the valve stem, replace core, inflate, shake, spin and ride the wheels.
review.name: Excellent (with the right tools)

review.reviewBody: The other reviews are spot on& nearly impossible to install with the airliner in place.  I say nearly, because with great determination and after breaking a tire mounting tool, I finally got the tire on the rim with this thing in place.  That's when I discovered the reason they supply a (special) replacement stem, since the air liner will block the air inlet on a normal tubeless stem.  Air can get in, but good luck injecting your sealant.  That's when I then discovered that i could not DISMOUNT my tire, as I couldn't get the tire tool under the bead.  Well that sucks.   Interesting concept, got it for the safety aspect, but the execution is unacceptable.
review.name: Can't install, needs special valve

review.reviewBody: Planned to change from tubes to tubeless. Having never used tubeless i wanted a backup system for a catastrophic failure. This seemed like a great idea. Spent nearly 2 hours with a friend trying to mount my tire with the air liner. It is absolutely impossible to get the tire over the rim with the air liner installed. The vittoria video instructions make it look so easy. Dont be fooled it is impossible. Its like trying to install a tire with a fully inflated tube. Good luck with that.  Will call tomorrow to return it and the vittoria tool that is made for this. That too doesn't work. If you're going tubeless stay away from this. Great idea if one can actually get it installed. I could not.
review.name: Great concept but impossible to use

review.reviewBody: Purchased the road liner and was excited to use on my 62mm front wheel. Unfortunately, the special valve stems supplied (side port opening to let sealant enter tire around the liner) don't have enough thread length to put on a threaded valve extender & the stem nut. Vittoria shows longer stems on their U.S. website but are not available to order. A deeper rim should allow a valve extender to be used without the threading issue.
review.name: good idea with the correct valve stem.

name: Air-Liner Road Tire Insert

review.reviewBody:
These waders simply get the job done. I've strapped them to my handlebars bikepacking, shoved them in my pack for alpine lake backpack trips, walked miles through nasty brush, scaled sharp basalt banks, and fished for steelhead in the brutal Idaho winters without complaint. Layer up your legs when it's cold, and let the Sonic Pros keep you dry. Durable and dependable, I am satisfied with my purchase and you will be, too. 

Wear a vest or backpack if you desire a few more pockets. 

I am 5'10" @180lbs and the ML is a tad tall but not unmanageable.
review.name: A Modest Workhorse

review.reviewBody: According to the measurements I got an L for my height... when I tried it on, the top was almost to my chin and I could get my gf in there with me as well. I was looking for a more snug fit to still be able to put on a few layers underneath. Seems solid construction otherwise.
review.name: Runs a size or two larger

review.reviewBody:
After first weekend out, very pleased with fit, function and durability. 

After 1.5 years of moderate use the crotch is leaking a bit, fabric is wearing and seam tape is coming unglued.  Otherwise very happy, and will work with the repair dept ad Redington on a fix.
review.name: Great value waders

review.reviewBody: Really like the concept of these gloves. The liner on its own with the ability to use electronic devices while wearing the glove is great. Then to have the additional outer sleeve that is wind and waterproof and yet easy to store on yourself makes it a great combo for any cool or inclement weather outdoor activity.
Easy to use with devices. Sometimes find liners to be difficult to use with my smart phone, but these are great!
review.name: Warm and thin

review.reviewBody: Overall these are some really versatile gloves. First couple of times I wore them I did not use the outer wind/water covers. It was probably in the upper 30s and they kept my hands warm. Not super toasty but definitely better than I expected due to how thin they are. I really like how grippy they are and they are very stretchy. It finally got cold enough, low 20s to truly test them while walking the dogs. Definitely needed the wind/water outer glove which fit well over the others. Plus they really work!  They did a great job blocking the wind and a light rain. Again, they kept my hands warm for a mile walk. Only downside is that the outer gloves are slick (not grippy) making it difficult to pick up some things. The fact that you can fold up and store the outer gloves in the inner gloves is super convenient and actually adds a bit more wind blocking and heat retention to the backs of your hands. Keep in mind these are light duty gloves - walking, driving, to and from work. Not sure I would use these to shovel snow or go skiing.
review.name: Great light gloves.

review.reviewBody: Excellent gloves and customer service by OR staff.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect hiking gloves to be used on moderately cold temperature days in Canada. They fit well under the OR Men's Revolution II GORE-TEX Gloves, they're great on their own especially when you've warmed up after hiking for a little while and the additional waterproof covers that are included are an excellent addition for wet weather to keep your hands dry over the liners or even on their own. Highly recommend, couldn't be happier with all my OR gear - truly a great brand who cares about their customers. I wear a Medium in these but an XL in the Men's Revolution II GORE-TEX Gloves.
review.name: Awesome Hiking Gloves!!!

review.reviewBody: I use these for winter/outdoor photography. They have enough flex that I can work my camera settings but thick enough they cut most cold weather.(most) I use the back zip pocket for a set of hand warmers to keep the blood flowing through my hands which helps a lot. In extremely cold temps this glove cannot work by itself but can be used as a liner with other systems. At 0f temps or below I will use this as a liner with Meteor Mitts or another flip-top mitten. These are also my daily gloves for casual use. The only negative is that they can be fiddly when trying to use a touch screen. I have to make sure they are positioned right before I start trying to use then this way. Not a deal breaker for me as I don't use this feature often.
review.name: Great gloves for base layer

review.reviewBody: This super versatile glove packs a punch. I run warm and these have kept my hands comfortable, warm and dry over hundreds of miles of varied terrain and temperature. The small lightweight profile makes for hassle free storage whether deep in your bag or on your gear loop for quick access. Soft or hardshell depending on the situation. 4 Thumbs up
review.name: Don't let looks fool you

review.reviewBody: Light rain but wet foliage. Walked foe about an hour and half before waterproof shell wetted out and inner just soaked up the water. Was pretty dissapointed as I still had another 3 hours of hiking to go..if you out for a short walk or run maybe suitable but if your doing longer than an hour look for something else.....sorry
review.name: Short term water protection

review.reviewBody: The warm gloves are nice, but what I find myself liking most is the shell. I actually have used the shell a few times already with a thinner liner I own, and that combo is really nice. Honestly, even if you just purchased this combo for the packable outer-shell, it would be worth it.
review.name: I recommend these gloves.

review.reviewBody: Terrible gloves. I should have listened to the poor reviews. Any cool temperatures - even just 40 degrees - these gloves are just inadequate. Shocked at how little warmth they provided for the cost of these. Steer clear (and now I am on the hook to pay return shipping).
review.name: Terrible gloves

Used these for climbing in Paklenica NP in Croatia. Really sharp rock but even after a week of climbing and being dragged over the rock they still look like new.

After comparing the ones I received to my other hiking trousers I can say they are just regular trousers, certainly not a slim fit. They are not as described "slim fit" and the fit of the pair I received was nothing like that shown in the photos. Returned the same day I received them, disappointing.

review.reviewBody:
Great pants for Tasmanian weather, The DWR is effective, as is the wind resistance. They are very comfortable walking in drizzle at 10 degrees C, without thermals. They don't feel wet on the leg even when they are to the hand's touch.
The tight leg fit means the cuffs grip my Scarpa Wrangell boots, no gaiter needed to keep out stones/leeches.
review.name: Great pants for Tasmanian weather,
