description: Buy the S.O.L Survive Outdoors Longer Escape Bivvy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Escape Bivvy
hasVariant.description: Buy the S.O.L Survive Outdoors Longer Escape Bivvy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This camping blanket is perfect for being outdoors. It keeps you dry and keeps heat in. Its water resistant. You can close yourself up in it or use it like a regular sleeping bag. The color is great in case you need it for being rescued. It makes it easier to see you. Also you can use it on tough terrain and not worry about it getting ripped or tore because its resistant to that also.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I decided to try this out once I received it. It's a nice, lightweight package that's easy to get out and put back up. The material itself seems very durable with waterproof outside fabric, and it was surprisingly less noisy than I thought it would be. It did a great job warming me up quickly and keeping me that way. This is great for camping, or even just packing for outdoor adventures in an emergency or "just in case" kit. Highly recommended!
review.name: Great to Keep for Emergency!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Went camping and it was colder than expected. Didn't want to freeze and get sick so I pulled my bivvy out and let me tell you I couldn't have been any warmer. The insolation on this is top notch and potentially saved me life and for that, with the price, would suggest anyone to have one for that just in case moment. You never know when you could need it and could save your life.
review.name: Freezing night made warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Tested this out in a few different temperature settings and didnt serve its purpose at all if you had to use only this to keep warm you would be in a very bad situation I personally would use the money to purchase a good blanket
review.name: Didnt reflect Body heat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great product and works great as promised. I travel around the US for work and it has me sleeping in my Van most of the time, during the colder weather I was looking for something that would keep me warm and cozy. This is great, already used it and it kept me warm all night
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love to go camping with my family during the year and I always want to make sure we are all safe and prepared. That being said, this blanket provides me with a lot of relief as I know that it will help us in times of need. We have already used it once when husband was going out for a camping trip. His tent got a bit too cold for his liking and took this escape tent out of the bag and got in it. He said it was insanely warm and warmed him up where he got back under his normal blanket in no time. He was impressed with how warm the blanket is inside when it is so lightweight.  While lightweight you can tell the high quality of this blanket, it is very durable and will last a long time. I will carry this in my trunk during the winter season in case we get in a snow storm. I am very impressed with the safety of this blanket.
review.name: Great for camping!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I gave this to my daughter for her car emergency kit, as she is a college student, and she travels home a lot from College. We live in Very Cold States, where it does get to below zero degrees with wind chill temps that can end a life if stranded and unprepared. She was thrilled when I gave this to her! She has wanted to add one to the Car forever! She only had a blanket in there before. First thing she did was test it out. Yes, you heard me, She tested it out!! It snowed here, so she spent the night outside in the freezing cold with only this for protection. She did not come inside once! She woke up in the morning and came back in and reported that she was very warm all night! I am so glad that she has this for protection now!!
review.name: Excellent Addition to Emergency Car Kit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this and was first shocked to see the compact size it it.  So light weight.  I open it it up and gave it a try.  Granted to was 54 degrees outside and sunny but it was quite toasty inside.  I could defuse how this could help out in an emergency situation.  I rolled it back up into its carry bag and placed it inside my Bug Out bag.  Works great with my little travel pillow too!
review.name: So cool

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like to be prepared when the weather gets colder because you never know when something might happen.  The SOL Escape Bivvy is going to be a great addition to my kit.  It is heat reflective, breathable, durable, waterproof and comfortable.  It is not bulky, so it doesn't take up a lot of room in my container. It has a drawstring so you can tighten the head area so that it molds around your head, covering almost your entire body. It was easy to roll back up and put back into it's spot, so that's a huge plus!  I always have a hard time rolling things back into the original form!
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I baught this item to add to our in case of emergency items that we have started gathering together as you never really know what's going to happen. Also ordered it to replace the one that we had. Having used it before I would highly recommend this item.
review.name: Great shape

name: Escape Bivvy

review.itemreviewed: Tamok Gore-Tex Performance Shell Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
After tearing through my Northface Freedom and Patagonia Powder Town Bibs on very basic falls, I knew I needed something more durable. I've only had these for a few wears, but they seem to fit the task, I slammed into a tree the other day and cut my knee up pretty bad...and my leg isn't doing so well, but the pants look completely fine.

The other big plus here is that these are one of the fewer gore-tex or "bomb-proof" bibs I could find that wasn't excessively baggy. They aren't as form fitting as backcountry pants, but they have little excess bulk and I like the look I have in them. Overall very well made and lots of little smart features built into them.
review.name: Trim-ish fit and Very Durable

name: Tamok Gore-Tex Performance Shell Bib Pant - Men's

review.name: Lightweight and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Im usually very hesitant when purchasing bottoms in this material but IM GLAD I DID! its hard finding exercise bottoms being a curvy girl but I absolutely love the way these fit !! Definitely gonna buy more !
review.name: Big booty friendly

review.reviewBody: So comfy & chic, perfect for hot summer days from the trails to the city streets. The fit was amazing and more accurate than other brands. I love them!
review.name: Finally, good shorts!

review.reviewBody: These shorts are an amazing color and the perfect lightweight option to beat some killer summer heat! I am so excited to elevate my hiking style.
review.name: Perfect color, perfect weight

review.reviewBody: The fabric these shorts are made out of shows every drop of sweat. If you want to use these for any kind of exercise be prepared to look like you wet yourself. It also drys very slowly. These photos were taken an hour after playing a game of tennis.
review.name: Fabric goes dark with sweat
comment: Hi there, thank you so much for submitting your review. We're so sorry to hear that the Adams Short did not meet your expectations. Rest assured that your feedback is important to us, and your review has been passed along to our teams so we can do better in the future!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Order a M which is my usual size however they ended up being a bit big. I felt the style wasnt that flattering so I returned them rather than exchanging for a S. Love the color, just not the right style for me.
review.name: Love the color but not the fit
comment: Hi there, thank you so much for submitting your review. We're so sorry to hear that the Adams Short did not fit to your liking. Rest assured your feedback has been passed along to our teams so we can do better in the future!

review.reviewBody: I havent stopped wearing these shorts! I got them for a trip to hike in the mountains and theyve become my go-to. Love the color, material, and they fit the vibe check every time.
review.name: Need these in every color!

review.reviewBody:
The fit is amazing. I think halfdays run pretty true to size. While the size down does fit, I prefer the slightly oversized fit. I even found going down to an XS was a bit uncomfy. I rather have the space to tighten which is made easy with the bungee adjustable waist. Please come out with more bright colors like the verdant and loganberry. The material has a beautiful sheen and it's rare to find hiking gear in such gorgeous colors.

One thing to note is that sunscreen tends to leave more of a stain behind, so make sure to apply any sunscreen or lotion and let it set before wearing this nylon.
review.name: Favorite short to hike in

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and length - first time I've had hiking shorts that I do not feel like I'm constantly dealing with riding up/wedgie issues. Release more colors so I can buy even more!
review.name: Favorite hiking shorts

review.reviewBody: Was so excited about these shorts, especially since I love half days for my ski gear, but was so disappointed after taking them on a four day backpacking trip. They were totally un-breatheable (sweat dripping from my upper thighs and no wicking), stained after dipping into the freshwater river, and took ages to dry. Lastly, they began delaminating into the inside after day two! Clearly needs some more iterations before these are outdoors ready.
review.name: Not suitable backpacking shorts

name: Adams Short - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I was hoping to find a glove liner that:
1. fit well and kept my hands warm in my mittens (Hestra fall line mitts size 8)
2. I could activate my iPhone to use my camera, music, etc


These didn't really do either. They would be a good stand alone glove if you are in an active cool environment and didn't want to use your phone.. 

I tried these in both 7 and 8 and found them to be too bulky (think expedition weight base layer( to really allow me to keep my hands warm inside my mitts. and the touch screen function didn't work.

I do love backcountry though for standing behind their products and offering returns within 30 days. Back to the drawing board for me.
review.name: Didn't work on my touchscreen - iPhone

review.reviewBody: I?ve never been more impressed with a liner glove. I ride my bike to work (in NYC) & purchased to wear under my gloves specifically through the wet & very windy winter. I haven?t had to wear my other gloves because these Hestra liner gloves are so warm & cut the wind so well! Definitely recommend!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Universal Couple Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My wife and I used this product to secure two sleeping pads (also Thermarest) together during a 5-night backpacking trip in the Grand Canyon. We wanted to have our own equipment (there was a chance we needed to sleep apart one of the nights), but also wanted to combine our bedding. We used two sleeping bags that zipped together, and we found that our pads would slide apart (even in our small two person tent) unless we used these straps. The only con is that it takes some time to unfold the straps, wrap them around the sleeping pads, and snug them up. When we added that to inflating two pads, unrolling two sleeping bags and zipping them together, we had a rather lengthy bedtime routine. But we slept well, and I'd recommend this product.
review.name: Works as described

review.reviewBody: I'm using this on two Luxury Map Pads ... an application where it works fine. Comparing these straps to ones I ordered in the past I find they're exactly the same size. Using them for two Mondo Kings is a different story where they work only after a struggle. Apparently you've decided it's not worth adding an inch or two to the length of the webbing to solve a problem that is so specific. Also there seems to be no way comment on the lack of a way to use MSR pumps to help deflate these types of pads.
review.name: Limited Avenues for Feedback and No Learning Curve at MSR

review.reviewBody: I use the couple kit to connect two large Mondo King Pads and it works but the straps are just BARELY long enough to do the job. In fact I have to to deform the pads to get enough slack to thread the straps through the buckles. Once together the kit works fine. It would be SO much better if the straps were an inch or two longer,
review.name: Only until someone makes one with a little longer straps

review.reviewBody: Purchased these straps several years ago, and am happy that my wife and I can cuddle dispite the sleeping bags. The gap that would form before usually ended in a sore hip and shoulder but not anymore.
review.name: No horrible gaps!

review.reviewBody: This is a great idea, but I cant figure out how the two ""X"" straps are to be used to attach the pads. There was no diagram or instructions that came with my purchase...
review.name: Great Idea

name: Universal Couple Kit

review.reviewBody: Ive had these for about a month. They fit great, very comfortable, and don't leak.
review.name: Comfy rubber boots!

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Coming undone where the rubber meets the cloth. I started wearing them in January. I wash a floor for 15 minutes at end of shift. I do not recommend.
review.name: Falling apart

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Works perfect for the ranch. Comfortable and easy on and off
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: At first these were great. I use them to walk along shoreline looking for agates, they were waterproof after 2 years of usage they are not waterproof any longer. The neoprene section will allow water into the boot. $159 was quite a lot of money for me. Now I have to look for new boots, maybe Muck brand.  They are great snow boots but not for immersion.
review.name: Was waterproof until they weren't

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfy on my wide foot and customer service was great when there was a shipping issue.
review.name: Excellent boots. Great if your foot is wide.

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and durable thoroughly impressed so far
review.name: Comfortable, durable

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I recently gave these boots to my boyfriend who works outdoors in the rain, and he has been loving them. They are waterproof, insulated, have tons of cushion and are very durable. They are definitely way better than other boots he has had in the past from other brands. They also are able to easily go over your pants or under them. They are also true to size. I highly recommend these boots, they are amazing.
review.name: The perfect work boot!

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really nice boots to work around the house, I bought a shorter pair of the same boots thinking it would be easier to put them in and out but I would say the effort is the same for both.
review.name: Pretty light and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I opted out for a soft-toe new lightweight design, this is my first pair of Bogs and first pair of rain/work boots to begin with, but I am pretty happy with the quality overall and they are easy in easy out plus comfortable to work around the house when the weather isn't the best.
review.name: Pretty light and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Workman Soft Toe Insulated Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had these for almost two years after working outside in all weather. On my second pair now.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: The waistband area is bulky. Lots of sewn-in elastic, about 2" tall and wrapping around the sides and back. I returned them before use, as I prefer a lighter feel/fit.
review.name: a bit bulkier than I like

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and the leg vents work well. The short sheds water and dirt well.
review.name: Fits true to size

review.reviewBody: Solid pair of shorts for the price. Love the chamois liner and belt that come with. They feel solid enough that they will last a long time but arent too hot on warmer rides in Colorado. Vents come in handy. Lots of pockets for the essentials. Overall a great pair of shorts.
review.name: Solid bike short

review.reviewBody: I've never owned a pair of MTB shorts until I bought these and I am very impressed. I like the built-in belt and liner shorts that snap into place. They have plenty of pockets, but there are no zippered cargo pockets (those are actually vents). The only pockets that are zippered are the hand pockets and one of the rear pockets (I guess for your wallet). The cargo pockets on the back of each leg just have a flap. I took them out on a 3-hour ride and they were very comfortable; the chamois was more than adequate. It was a perfect weather day with temps in the low 70s; so, I left the vents open and stayed comfortable throughout the ride. The fit was kind of tricky with these. According to the chart, my waist size (32-33 depending on the cut) is small; that just didn't seem right. I'm 6'1" around 170lbs and I've never worn a small anything. So, I ordered a medium and they fit perfect. I hope this helps.
review.name: Well Thought Out

name: Hummvee Short With Liner - Men's

review.reviewBody: As I wear them more and more, Im always looking for sun shirts that are more than a long-sleeved t-shirt with a hood. The Hybrid Tahoe is a step in the right direction, great fabric and colors with a snap front and useful front pockets  which unfortunately wont stay shut because the tiny plastic pocket snap closures are so unreliable. The larger snap closures on the front of the shirt seem to work fine so far, but I am concerned that they might be a weak link in the long run, too. I dont understand how other vendors have perfectly useful snap buttons on performance fabric western-style shirts, but Backcountry decided to go another route. Im keeping it, but I shouldnt be worried that I might need to replace something as basic as a snap closure on a $100 sunshirt from a reputable vendor. Time will tell.
review.name: Unique hooded sun shirt.

review.reviewBody:
I really like the fit and style of this shirt as it is a little different from the standard pull over sun hoody (not as clingy).  It is a good adituon to my fly fishing and backpacking trips. It is a little heavier than my other sun hoodys but the material also feels a bit more substantial. I am not sure if the pockets will get much use but the zippered one can act as a vent when open.

The only real issues are 1. The funky plastic snaps in place of buttons...why? Do they do something different? They are a little cumpersome and you are never quite sure if they are snapped correctly. Please explain. 2. The branding is a bit much...the logo plus the Backcountry name? Again why? Pick one and make it subtle please.

I like it enough to buy another in a different color so we shall see how well they hold up.
review.name: Nice style with a few quirks

name: Hybrid Tahoe Sun Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: I find that by purchasing direct the bloks are fresher than when buying elsewhere. Strawberry is my favorite.

review.reviewBody: Tastes good, easy to digest, the multiple pre-sized blocks are ingenious and make for easy use while on the move.

review.reviewBody: I use Clif Bloks when I ride bike. They are easy to pop in your mouth but difficult to chew under intense exercise. I often break it up in little chunks and let them dissolve slowly.
review.name: Great Taste and a staple in my cycling snack arsenal

review.reviewBody: I will eat a package of the Black Cherry about 20 minutes before a MTB ride as a snack and also for a small caffeine pick me up and it works perfect!
review.name: Great snack and low caffeine pick up before a MTB ride

review.reviewBody: Great for replenishing the sodium lost after a long ride on the bike!
review.name: Most favorite flavor!

review.reviewBody: Great for my training rides and on race days. Easy on the belly too. Time to order more.
review.name: So tasty and helps me make it through a ride

review.reviewBody: best tasting caffeine supplement ever! identical to candy!
review.name: very addicting! hard to stop eating....

review.reviewBody: Love the packaging...so easy to access on the go with the long tube. And the flavor is really delicious!
review.name: Great taste and easy to eat while exercising

review.reviewBody: This is a favorite in our household of cyclists. It's easy to handle with one hand when riding, portioned in the right bite size where you can take one or two blocks at a time. Strawberry is one of our top two favorite flavors.
review.name: Easy to eat on the road

review.reviewBody: I never received it. It was cancelled because it was out of stock. I love it so have been looking in places here in Orlando to find it,

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes for trail running. They are super comfortable without breaking in and grip is excellent. I have been using these shoes for 7 years and even though I took off a star for the mesh wearing out prematurely I keep reordering them every time because I have not found a running shoe I like more.
review.name: trail running

review.reviewBody: I took the insole out and it was more comfortable. I wore them all over Europe and they were comfortable and sure footed on the cobblestone
review.name: Europe Bound

review.reviewBody: I ordered these shoes for a 18 mile roi trip hike th the confluence along the Havasupai creek in the Grand Canyon. There were many many water crossings. I wore a thin pair of wool socks with them and they worked perfect! Very gripping and dried quickly after every trek thru the water.  Socks kept the sand out and I had no blisters and feet were happy all day long!
review.name: The real MVP of our hike

review.reviewBody: Bought these to hike the 20 miles confluence hike from Havasupai with 20 river crossings. They were the perfect water hiking shoe. I wore thin smartwool socks with them. No blisters, no raw spots, great traction and my feet werent even sore after that distance. I wear 7.5 and prefer a wide shoe. The 7.5 was perfect size for me.
review.name: Perfect water hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: These shoes are comparable to altras (which Ive worn for years). The rubber seems more durable and longer lasting! I love these trail runners so far! Ive put about 300 miles (backpacking) on them and they are still going strong
review.name: Thru hiking tester

review.reviewBody: We love our TR1 Astrals. We are going to enjoy them everywhere we go!
review.name: TR1 Astral

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair of TR1s. I shredded the mesh on the first pair doing field work on the river. Honestly, they held up better than I expected! While my first pair was true to size, this new pair was too short, so I sized up a half size and theyre perfect. Very comfortable and rad color. These shoes are nice when you need to be in and out of the water, and need some protection from plants and rocks. Shipping was fast and exchange process was a breeze.
review.name: Good looking and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable:  I wore the TR1 for the first time on a 5.5hr flight to Oahu and the shoe did fine. I did not get any blisters or chafing from the shoe. I paired it with lightweight ankle socks and it was comfortable. I've worn them on walks and small hikes with my daughter in HI,  5+mile walks in GreenLake and downtown Seattle, and the shoes kept my feet comfortable. Heavy duty enough for your day hikes and lightweight enough for your daily treks across town.
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: This shoe is a great water/hiking combo shoe. Traction is superb.  Wore this shoe for a Boundary Waters trip and it performed perfectly!
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight with a roomy toe box.  Very comfortable out of the box.
review.name: Comfy trail shoe

name: Tr1 Mesh Water Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Cool glasses, they were a bit big for my daughter to use for softball. When I tried to exchange I was told to keep them and was refunded my money, and I was able to order a smaller style. Will order from them again.
review.name: A little big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second pair (lost the first pair). Very durable and they dont slip down your nose. I wear them daily and I would recommend them to anyone.
review.name: Nice glasses!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the look of The Future is Void sunglasses. I lost the first pair I bought & had to go straight out & replace them with the same style! Ok, I actually picked up some other styles too. A style for each of my many moods!
review.name: Gotta Have 'Em

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have very sensitive eyes and always still have to squint when wearing sunglasses but I don't with these! They are super lightweight and stay in place all through your outdoor workouts and adventures. 10/10 recommend
review.name: Never have to squint

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality for the price. Look good as well.
review.name: Great glasses!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These sunglasses rock! Love the bomb pop colors and the mirrored lenses. The perfect look for when youre chasing your crazy! F-Gravity, buy these sunnies!!!
review.name: YEEEAAAHHHH!!!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These glasses make me feel like Macho Man Randy Savage
review.name: killer shades

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect glasses for a cloudy day rode. Love the rose colored lense. They are the perfect protection, when shade isnt needed. Light and comfortable.
review.name: Go to glasses

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] One of my favorite pairs for riding. The wrap around lense is great on a windy day and they have just the right amount of tint . Comfortable too.
review.name: Perfect!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love my new shades! I have a lot of Goodrs, but these may be my favorite as they are so eye catching.
review.name: So fun!

name: The Wrap G Polarized Sunglasses
